sect2.title: System requirements
sect2.para: The JBuilder Plug-in requires JBuilder 5.0 or higher.
See for the basic requirements to run Jalopy.

sect2.title: Installation
sect2.para: The Plug-in comes either as a single .zip or compressed .tar file. Unzipping either one of these files into a directory of your choice (referred to as <INST_DIR>) will produce two subdirectories /bin and /docs.
Remove all files from any prior Jalopy version from your JBuilder extension directory (/lib/ext).

Further installation is simple: just copy all files from your <INST_DIR>/bin folder into the /lib/ext directory of your JBuilder distribution. JBuilder will then need to be restarted before Jalopy begins working.

sect2.title: AppBrowser main menu
sect2.para: The software adds two new menu items into the main menu of the AppBrowser to seamlessly integrate with JBuilder:

listitem.para: Formats the current editor view. Use this item if you need to format the current opened file.
Only available if there is an open view that contains a Java source file.
Use this item if you want to configure your settings to control the layout of any formatted code.

sect2.title: Project pane popup-menu
sect2.para: There will also be a new menu item available at the end of the popup-menu of the Project pane: Format. Use this item if you want to format several files at once. All currently selected files are formatted.
If it happens that a file has an open editor view, this view will be updated, not the actual file. You have to save the view first to see the physical file updated.

sect2.title: Editor view popup menu
sect2.para: Both the Format <file> and Jalopy Options... items can be also reached via the popup menu of the active editor view.
